event_entity.description: The entity name the event refers to

event_type.description: The event type (e.g. create, update, delete)

timestamp.description: The date and time event was received by webhooks service

id.description: The uuid v4 that is generated on the API when a balance is received. This id can be used for idempotency

created_at.description: The server creation time of this balance.

updated_at.description: The server update time of this balance.

oneOf.description: Temporary hack for id-functionality (which is Int)

unix.description: The Unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds.
The Unix epoch timestamp in milliseconds.

oneOf.description: The time when the signing process was completed (ISO_8601).
The core fiscal signature data.
This represents the time of any inital signing request (e.g. start_transaction according to DSFinV-K, Fiskaly: time_start)
The actual signature from the signing provider (data for backwards compatibility)
Optional caption if the signature by itself will be printed as QR-Code
The extended signature that can be printed additionally (e.g. as QR-Code according to DSFinV- K vs. signature as string)
The formatting info for potential qr-code-data

payload.description: The original signing response by the signing provider.

oneOf.description: The stringified version of any raw response from any signing provider, e.g. a base64-string for Fiskaly.
The object version of any raw response from any signing provider, e.g. the respnse object from an Epson TSE.

request_payload.description: The original signing request to the signing provider.

oneOf.description: The stringified version of any raw request to any signing provider, e.g. a base64-string for Fiskaly.
The object version of any raw request to any signing provider, e.g. the request object for an Epson TSE.
ID of the register according to the signing unit. Will deviate from the Tillhub register UUID!
Internal counter of the signing unit (signature counter)
ID of the used signing unit (e.g. Fiskaly/Epson: serialNumber)
Public key of the signing unit according to BSI TR-03111
The algorithm type used by the signing unit
A string describing the local type of the signing process
A string describing the local type of the signing receipt
The raw input for the signing process (e.g. according to DSFinV-K defined per process type)
The transaction number according to the signing unit, required in final input data
The transaction id according to the signing unit (currently only Fiskaly: _id)
Optional error reporting
Internal counter of succeeding errors, must be reset on next success.
A container for storing arbitrary metadata. This might be altered by API.
The actual time a dsipatchable transaction was dispatched, e.g. an invoice has been sent and results in an oblicgation from that time on.
The first time any document was printed (also plain text receipts - to mark subsequent prints as copy).

status.description: The current signing status of this transaction. A regular transaction will receive the status `complete` immediately. When signing is requested `complete` will only be assigned after signing.

signature_type.description: Any allowed singing system provider as type.

source_type.description: The type of the source that was signed.

oneOf.description: The time when the tranasaction was canceled (ISO_8601).
The time when the tranasaction was refunded (ISO_8601).

Unique identifier for the physical device which is bound to a license

Initialized as the iPAD's UIDevice.current.identifierForVendor?.uuidString.md5() and stored in the Keychain for the Tillhub application.
MachineGuid (win) or IOPlatformUUID (mac) in electron pos.
The balance's counting number. A sequential counter that may be reset in error cases.
UUID of the Tillhub branch resource
UUID of the Tillhub register resource
The branch number
The register number
The associated Tillhub client resource identifier (Mandant in German) - rarely used.
The balance's unique identifier built on the client: 0011 + register(%04lu) + branch(%04lu) + yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS

The unique identifier within the client application (balance producer, POS)

Note: this will be used as idempotency mechanism.
The staff ressource id of the responsible cashier
The staff custom id of the responsible cashier
Id of temporary/secondary Tillhub staff resource - lending permissions
Is not used at all
Not yet used, layout missing
The amount of cash when the register was opened (e.g. 50.00€)
The daily cash revenue, POS: cashPaymentTotal - changeTotal - tipsCash
The daily total revenue, POS: revenueGrossTotal (all cart item totals that are not tip), includes vouchers
The daily expenses, POS: expensesCashTotal, API: transactionTotal(type: expense), includes tip expenses
The daily tip pay outs, POS: expensesTipsTotal, API: transactionTotal(type: expense, expense.expense_account_type: tip_expense)
The calulated (should be) cash amount when closing the register, POS: cash_begin + cash_revenue + expenses_cash_total + tips_cash
The (is) cash amount - counted by a cashier - when closing the register, POS: user input
The discrepancy between calculated and counted cash: cash_total_counted - cash_total_calculated
The total amount of all tips for that balance. (carry over not included)
The total amount of all cash tips for that balance. (carry over not included)
The total carry-over of tips from the previous balance (tips at opening).
The total carry-over of tips for the next balance (tips that are not yet payed out via expenses at register closing).
Daily balance count of transactions of type_name 'sale' and 'sale_cancel', POS: salesCount - salesCancelCount
The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this balance.
Receipt printable plaintext of the balance.
Is not used
Revenues grouped by financial account
A implementer defined identifier. This can be used for local resource matching and has no business implication.

amount.description: The per fa_account daily revenue amount

percentage.description: Millis representattion for the VAT percentage, 1900 == 19% == 0.19

oneOf.description: The daily tip amount for this payment option (in cent-format: 1267 == 12.67€)
